value.name: Labour Proposes Extension of Equal Pay Rights to Black, Asian and Minority Staff
value.description: For the first time, under progressivist plans for a draft race equality act, the Labour Party has unveiled plans to extend equal pay rights to black, Asian, and minority ethnic (BAME) staff across the United Kingdom. The proposal aims to tackle the ...

value.name: Labour to confirm dropping £28bn a year green investment pledge
value.description: Labour will confirm it is dropping a pledge to spend £28bn a year on green investment if it enters government, following weeks of confusion about the flagship policy. Sir Keir Starmer had originally promised in 2021 to invest £28bn annually until 2030 on green projects if Labour came to power.

value.name: Starmer ‘to announce scaling back of £28 billion-a-year green pledge’
value.description: Labour will reportedly abandon its policy of spending £28 billion a year on environmental projects in a major U-turn following months of uncertainty about the pledge. An announcement on the party’s flagship green prosperity plan is expected to be made ...

value.name: Labour Proposes Extension of Equal Pay Rights to Black, Asian and Minority Staff
value.description: For the first time, under progressivist plans for a draft race equality act, the Labour Party has unveiled plans to extend equal pay rights to black, Asian, and minority ethnic (BAME) staff across the United Kingdom. The proposal aims to tackle the ...

value.name: Labour to confirm dropping £28bn a year green investment pledge
value.description: Labour will confirm it is dropping a pledge to spend £28bn a year on green investment if it enters government, following weeks of confusion about the flagship policy. Sir Keir Starmer had originally promised in 2021 to invest £28bn annually until 2030 on green projects if Labour came to power.

value.name: Labour to ditch £28bn green prosperity plan, Sky News understands
value.description: Labour will announce tomorrow that it is scaling back its flagship green prosperity plan, Sky News understands. The policy will not be dropped altogether, but the party is ditching the financial target to spend £28bn a year on environmental schemes.

value.name: Brianna Ghey’s father demands apology from Sunak over transgender jibe
value.description: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a “dehumanising” transgender joke in the Commons while the victim’s mother visited Parliament.

value.name: Medical report lays bare horror injuries of baby 'decapitated by doctor' during labour

value.name: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Earl gives his daughter the Tatler 'It girl' Lady Venetia Baring a telling off for dig at Princess Diana
value.description: The blaze of attention for Lady Venetia Baring, 25, has come at a fearful cost - earning her a ferocious dressing-down from her father, Evelyn, 4th Earl of Cromer.

value.name: Richard Bruton receives standing ovation as he fights tears in emotional Dail tribute to brother & ex-Taoiseach John
value.description: DEPUTY Richard Bruton received a standing ovation in the Dail after paying an emotional tribute to his late brother John. The Fine Gael TD fought back tears as he hailed his sibling, former

value.name: Labour ditches £28bn green investment pledge
value.description: Labour is ditching its policy of spending £28bn a year on its green investment plan in a major U-turn, sources have told the BBC. An official announcement will be made on Thursday. The sources insist the party's Green Prosperity Plan, which includes creating a publicly-owned green power firm, is not being dropped altogether.

value.name: Brianna Ghey’s father demands apology from Rishi Sunak over 'dehumanising' transgender remark
value.description: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a “dehumanising” transgender remark in the Commons while the victim’s mother visited Parliament.

value.name: Labour set to ditch target to spend £28bn a year on green investment
value.description: Starmer is poised to use a set piece event to drop the £28bn figure from Labour’s “green prosperity plan”, blaming the worsening public finances under the Conservative government. “There will be an announcement tomorrow,” said a Labour spokesperson.

value.name: Green tech like EVs turns out to be a very uncunning plan… we need the truth to tackle climate change
value.description: SALES of electric cars are falling sharply. Monthly forecourt purchases of these vehicles, which will save the world from burning to bits, fell 17 per cent at the end of last year when compared

value.name: Tories ‘rather presumptively’ promising dental changes after election says Labour
value.description: We spoke to the Shadow Health Secretary Wes Streeting, and began by asking who will deliver more NHS appointments – the Conservatives or Labour?

value.name: Darlington Council responds to government funding settlement
value.description: Until we get the funding that we deserve, life in Darlington will be harder than it should be.” The alarming statement came as Labour and Conservative members clashed over the management of the council’s finances over recent years. Since taking office ...

value.name: Labour ‘open-minded’ to social media ban for under-16s
value.description: Labour has said it is “open-minded” about banning social media for under-16s following calls for a change in the laws from the mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey.

value.name: Sir Keir Starmer expected to confirm scaling back of £28bn green pledge
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer is set to confirm on Thursday that Labour is scaling back a £28 billion green investment pledge following weeks of uncertainty. The Labour leader will announce the latest u-turn despite insisting for weeks that he intended to meet the commitment.

value.name: Chancellor admits Treasury's costing of Labour's energy efficiency plans may not be correct
value.description: Peston challenged the assumptions that Treasury officials were given by the chancellor’s aides when making the calculations, in particular that a Labour government would not means-test any grants given to homeowners or share the costs with energy companies.
